lead_paragraph: Mr. Bentley, responding to accusations by Spencer Collier, who had been fired as the state’s top law enforcement official, admitted making sexually charged remarks.

headline.print_headline: Alabama Governor Admits Sexual Remarks but Denies Affair With Top Aide
headline.main: Alabama Governor, Robert Bentley, Denies Having Affair With Aide

snippet: Mr. Bentley, responding to accusations by Spencer Collier, who had been fired as the state’s top law enforcement official, admitted making sexually charged remarks.
abstract: Alabama Gov Robert Bentley admits he made inappropriate sexual remarks to aide Rebekah Caldwell Mason but denies having had affair with her while still married to his wife; Bentley has not indicated he intends to resign, but scandal may damage his reputation with conservative voters who elected him based on morally upright reputation.
